name: Mini Pumpkin Pies
description: Mini Pumpkin Pies are almost too cute to eat and way easier to make than the full sized version! You will love the buttery pie crust and perfectly spiced pumpkin filling.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup vegan butter, cold and cut into cubes
1/2 cup vegetable shortening (or more vegan butter)
Coconut Whipped Cream (or other non-dairy whip)
sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice mix, optional

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and spray a mini muffin pan with non-stick spray. If you have two, spray them both. I only have one, so I baked them one tray at a time.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F and spray a mini muffin pan with non-stick spray. If you have two, spray them both. I only have one, so I baked them one tray at a time.

itemListElement.text: Add flour, sugar and salt to a food processor. Pulse a few times.
itemListElement.name: Add flour, sugar and salt to a food processor. Pulse a few times.

itemListElement.text: Add the cold cubed vegan butter and shortening. Pulse until it looks crumbly.
itemListElement.name: Add the cold cubed vegan butter and shortening. Pulse until it looks crumbly.

itemListElement.text: While the food processor is running, drizzle in 6-8 tablespoons of ice cold water. When it begins to clump together, stop. It will still be quite messy.
itemListElement.name: While the food processor is running, drizzle in 6-8 tablespoons of ice cold water. When it begins to clump together, stop. It will still be quite messy.

itemListElement.text: Dump the messy dough onto a floured surface and shape it into a ball. Roll the dough with a rolling pin. You don't want the crust too thick or too thin, about 1/4 inch thick is perfect.
itemListElement.name: Dump the messy dough onto a floured surface and shape it into a ball. Roll the dough with a rolling pin. You don't want the crust too thick or too thin, about 1/4 inch thick is perfect.

itemListElement.text: Using a 2.5 inch round cookie cutter (may also use a glass or measuring cup to cut), cut out rounds of the dough.
itemListElement.name: Using a 2.5 inch round cookie cutter (may also use a glass or measuring cup to cut), cut out rounds of the dough.

itemListElement.text: Place the dough circles into the muffin pan, pressing the dough flat on the bottom. They don't have to be perfect and they won't be at the very top of the muffin cup area.
itemListElement.name: Place the dough circles into the muffin pan, pressing the dough flat on the bottom. They don't have to be perfect and they won't be at the very top of the muffin cup area.

itemListElement.text: Once the pan (or two) are lined with the pie crust dough, place in the freezer while you make the filling. If making one pan at a time like me, place the rest of the pie crust in a ball in the refrigerator until ready to use.
itemListElement.name: Once the pan (or two) are lined with the pie crust dough, place in the freezer while you make the filling. If making one pan at a time like me, place the rest of the pie crust in a ball in the refrigerator until ready to use.

itemListElement.text: To a blender, add all the pumpkin filling ingredients and blend until smooth. If you don't have a blender, whisk or mix everything very well.
itemListElement.name: To a blender, add all the pumpkin filling ingredients and blend until smooth. If you don't have a blender, whisk or mix everything very well.

itemListElement.text: Remove the muffin tin from the freezer, and spoon about 1 tablespoon of filling into each unbaked crust. Fill to the top of the crusts.
itemListElement.name: Remove the muffin tin from the freezer, and spoon about 1 tablespoon of filling into each unbaked crust. Fill to the top of the crusts.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 22-24 minutes, until the crust edges are lightly golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before using a sharp knife to gently pop them out of the pan. Transfer to a cooling rack. If you are baking one pan at a time, start the process over and bake the second pan.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 22-24 minutes, until the crust edges are lightly golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before using a sharp knife to gently pop them out of the pan. Transfer to a cooling rack. If you are baking one pan at a time, start the process over and bake the second pan.

itemListElement.text: You can enjoy them warm right away, or refrigerate them for a few hours for a firmer filling.
itemListElement.name: You can enjoy them warm right away, or refrigerate them for a few hours for a firmer filling.

itemListElement.text: Serve with a bit of vegan whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice mix or cinnamon, if desired.
itemListElement.name: Serve with a bit of vegan whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice mix or cinnamon, if desired.

itemListElement.text: Store in the refrigerator, covered for about 5-6 days. They freeze well, too.
itemListElement.name: Store in the refrigerator, covered for about 5-6 days. They freeze well, too.
